Description: Beige and brown mottled steatite scarab: engraved on the base with a twisted rope design flanked by the plants of Lower Egypt, arranged vertically to the central design. There is a hole pierced through longitudinally. Chipped.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Bibliographic references: Giveon R 1985a / Egyptian scarabs from Western Asia from the collections of the British Museum (p.92, no.90)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Bagshaw Museum and Art Gallery, Batley
